Key Match Events: Northern Ireland had two goals ruled out and hit the post in the first half.
Conor Bradley created a string of opportunities for his team-mates.
Belarus made it seven clean sheets in their last nine competitive games.
19-year-old goalkeeper Pierce Charles enjoyed a quiet night on his debut.
Bradley had the ball in the net in the ninth minute, but was offside.
Eoin Toal hit the post in the 39th minute.
Belarus were denied a penalty in the 66th minute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played behind closed doors due to UEFA restrictions after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Pierce Charles and Shea Charles became the 23rd set of brothers to play for Northern Ireland or Ireland.
